page.title: 08EMPLOYMENT IN HUNTINGDON.
page.content: The greater London expansion scheme in the late fifties brought many new private industries to the town and saw the development of the industrial estate. These are mainly light and include plastic, rubber, moulding, engineering, eletronics, construction, industries and farm machinery. Skilled and unskilled work is also provided by the county and district council and also the civil service.The large hospital and county police headquarters also provide employment along with the retail industry.There is an highly productive agricultural industry but in a mechanical age this doesn't provide a high degree of employment but seasonal work is available. The level of unemployment is approximately 10 %.The main British Rail route caters for the London commuter.
